El señor Camilo tiene 63 años, es casado vive con su señora y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad, de los cuales dos de sus hijos lo ayudan en su negocio.
Camilo comenta que desde muy joven trabajó como chofer haciendo fletes, años posteriores gracias a sus ahorros pudo abrir su propia empresa de venta de materiales de construcción, hoy en día es una de la más importantes de la ciudad de Ybycuí, todo ello se debió al trabajo arduo y la buena atención que brindaba.-
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de más productos varios, como ser cemento, arena, varillas, piedras y demás, y así seguir dando a su clientela una buena calidad de productos.
texts.en:
Camilo is 63 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and has 5 grown children. Two of them help him in his business. 
Camilo says that he used to work as a delivery driver when he was young. He was able to save enough money from that job to start his own business selling building materials, and today his is one of the most important locations in the city of Ybycuí. All of this due to hard work and good service he's always provided.
He is requesting for this loan to invest in the purchase of various products, such as cement, sand, rods, stones and others, to continue providing his customers with good quality products.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rods, stones and others

loans.name: Mary Roxana

texts.es: La señora Mary vive en la provincia de Tiraque, cuenta con escasos recursos económicos, de estado civil soltera, tiene muchas ganas de superarse, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, administra eficientemente su actividad económica, se dedica  a la venta de material escolar en su tienda, además también vende en su bazar juguetes, peluches y regalos,  razón por la que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito de comercio para comprar mercadería para su tienda y aumentar su capital, de esa forma mejora su negocio y lo engrandecerá, para incrementar sus ingresos y cambiar las condiciones en la que vive , en su actividad económica trabaja sola  y no contrata ningún personal fijo, vive en una casa donde está en calidad de cuidadora, según  demuestra es una persona sencilla pero muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir creciendo de manera profesional.
texts.en:
Señora Mary lives in Tiraque province.  She is single and has limited financial resources.  She really wants to improve herself.  She is a responsible and hardworking person who efficiently carries out her job.  

She works selling school supplies in her store.  Additionally, she sells toys, stuffed animals, and gifts in her store.  She finds her self needing to ask for a business loan to buy merchandise for her store and increase her capital.  In this way she will improve and expand her business in order to increase her income and change the conditions she lives in.  She works alone in her business; she hasn’t hired anyone.  

She lives in a house where she works as a caregiver.  She is a simple person but very hardworking, with a strong desire to improve her quality of life and keep growing professionally.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene 38 años,  vive con su esposo y una hija, él se dedica en la venta de ropas para damas y niños en forma ambulante y también tiene un salón en su casa desde el año 2000.
Su esposo es albañil y las veces que no trabaja en albañilería también le ayuda a su esposa en sus ventas de prendas. Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora que con sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. El préstamo que pide es para comprar uniformes para colegio y útiles escolares, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir generando ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is 38 years old.  She lives with her husband and a daughter.  She works as a mobile vendor selling ladies’ and children’s clothing. She also has had a salon in her house since 2000.

Her husband is a construction worker, and at times when he isn’t working in construction he also helps his wife in her clothing sales.  Maria is a very hardworking woman who is getting ahead with sacrifice and effort.  The loan that she is requesting is to buy school uniforms and school supplies, because is this way she will be able to keep generating income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and school supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 47 años de edad, actualmente ella está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Gloria se levanta a las 4:30 AM junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa, oficio que aprendio de su madre, su esposo trabaja en las parcelas y camina 3 km para llegar al lugar. En el transcurso de la tarde Gloria se dedica a ordeñar las vacas para elaborar queso y luego venderlo. 

Con el prestamo que ella esta solicitando, podrá comprar una vaca lo que le permitira producir mas leche para la elaboración de queso y así incrementar sus ingresos para el hogar.

Entre sus planes a futuro estan, comprar un local en el mercado para vender su mercaderia, ella sabe que lo puede lograr con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de ropa y de la elaboración de queso.
texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and is currently in a relationship. Her husband is a farmer.

Gloria and her husband wake up at 4:30 A.M. so that they can proceed with their daily activities. She is a clothing merchant who learned the trade from her mother. Her husband works on their land, which requires him to walk three kilometers in order to get there. In the afternoons, Gloria spends her time milking the cows so that she can make cheese that she can sell later.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a cow, which will allow her to produce more milk for making cheese. This will help to increase her household income. Her plans for the future include buying a space at the market where she can sell her products. Gloria knows that she can accomplish this goal with the revenue she generates from selling clothes and making cheese.

loans.use: to buy a cow so that she will have more milk for making cheese.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, todas ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, con lo cual podrán conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuentra.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gilda quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que se encuentra con ingresos muy escasos,  donde ella a través del esfuerzo,  el trabajo y por medio de la venta de productos Avon, monique y también de bijouterie que hace, es que está saliendo adelante. Gilda es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por su familia para poder darles una vida digna.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos Avon y bijouterie para la venta, ya que por medio de esto podrá seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas [Women United] group was formed in the city of San Lorenzo.  All of them are doing the poverty elimination survey program, with which they will be able to understand the situation that they find themselves in.

One of the members is Señora Gilda, who in the last survey showed a poverty level within level one, which is to say that she finds herself with very little income.  Through her efforts and work selling Avon, Monique products, and costume jewelry, she is getting ahead.  Gilda is a very selfless woman who struggles for her family to be able to give them a decent life.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of Avon products and costume jewelry to sell.  Through doing this she will be able to keep fighting to improve her own living conditions and those of her family.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy Avon products and costume jewelry

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Unidas se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son de una zona rural, que aún está en crecimiento, y donde todas ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Maria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien se dedica a la actividad de cría de animales de corral, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo está luchando para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados, con lo que podrá seguir con la cría de sus animales, como así también seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Unidas (Women United) women's committee was formed by a group of neighbors in the city of Santaní. This is a rural area, that is still growing, and all of this members are doing their best to improve their living conditions. 
Maria is one of them. She makes a living breeding farm animals, she is a very hardworking woman who puts all her efforts into helping her loved ones. 
She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of balanced feed, to continue breeding her animals, as well as to keep working and fighting every day to have a better living.

loans.use: buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Adiman

texts.en:
Adiman runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. Adiman lives in Indramayu, a semi- urban area about six hours from Jakarta.  Adiman is married and appears in the picture with his customer.

Adiman began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, he has around $500 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). He took a loan from Kiva to buy a printer to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payment).

loans.use: to buy a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casada, y cuenta que es dueña de un comedor en el cual trabaja desde hace 2 años. Juana comenta que ya se ha hecho de una clientela bien variada que siempre asiste a su comedor.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y cuenta que su sueño es poder ampliar su local y tener el día de mañana un comedor más amplio.
Juana pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en verduras, condimentos, carnes, enlatados y demás, para poder seguir con su trabajando, tratando de mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Juana is from Santaní City. She is married, and she's owned a diner for 2 years. Juana says she has a steady clientele that frequents her place. 
She is a very self-sacrificing person who with great effort is moving forward to fulfill her dream to expand this location in the future. 
Juana is asking for this loan to invest in vegetables, spices, meat, canned foods and others to continue her work, trying to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, meat, canned foods and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a gas cooking package

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: Sebastiana de 24 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace barios años,ella esta muy feliz porque kiva le ha ayudado a salir adelante en su negocio ya que por medio de las ganancias que genera ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando un nuevo credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en calzado para la venta.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 24 years old and has been selling shoes for several years. She is very happy because Kiva is willing to help her business move forward. With the income she generates, Sebastiana is able to help her family with the household expenses.

She is taking this opportunity to request a new loan so that she can buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Bayardo

texts.es: Bayardo, es un hombre de 40 años de edad, vive en Maldonado, parroquia de Tulcán, es divorciado, tiene dos hijos, una niña y un niño, es divorciado, sus hijos viven con la madre, es amigable y responsable. Desde hace 3 años atrás se dedica al cultivo de naranjilla. El necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para el cuidado de sus cultivos de naranjilla. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio propio como una tienda de víveres en la zona, además quiere que su negocio del cultivo le vaya muy bien con la ayuda del préstamo.
texts.en:
Bayardo is a 40-year-old man who lives in Maldonado, a parish of Tulcán. He is divorced and has two children, a daughter and a son. His children live with their mother. Bayardo is friendly and responsible. For the past three years, he has been cultivating naranjilla.

He needs a loan so that he can buy supplies for maintaining his naranjilla crop. His dream is to have a business of his own, such as a local grocery store. In addition, he wants his farming business to do very well with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for maintaining his naranjilla crop.

loans.name: Virgen De Itati Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Itati está formado por mujeres muy luchadoras que gracias al esfuerzo de todas están en  el 3° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con el cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a ello poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien tiene una despensa en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, hasta muy noche. Ella comenta que con mucho sacrificio fue levantando su negocio y que hoy en día ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compra de ella los productos que necesitan.
La Sra. Ramona solicita el préstamo para la compra de verduras, panificados, frutas, enlatados y otros productos para poder venderlos en su despensa y cumplir con su meta de seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Itati group consists of women who are real fighters, asking for their third loan as a women's committee. They all work to get ahead. They are also participating of the elimination of poverty survey, which will help them improve their living conditions. 
One of their members, Ramona, owns a pantry. She works every day for very long hours. She says that with hard work, she's been able to build her business and today she has loyal customers who always buy products they need from her. 
Ramona is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables, bread, fruit, canned goods and other products to sell in her pantry and fulfill her goal to continue offering customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, bread, fruit, canned goods and other products

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora que con sacrificio esta saliendo adelante, ella es vendedora de calzados y otro tipo de productos que con sacrificio ha ido mejorando. Gracias a su préstamo anterior ha podido surtir su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.
Pide de este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de vestiditos, conjuntitos y calzados para criaturas, y de esa forma poder ofrecer una mejor variedad a sus clientes, de la misma forma en la que viene haciéndolo.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking woman getting ahead due to her hard work, selling shoes and other products to improve her life. Thanks to her previous loan she was able to expand her business and offer her customers a large variety of products. 
She is requesting this new loan to invest in buying dresses, two piece garments and shoes for children, and thus be able to offer a better variety to her customers, as she has been doing this far.

loans.use: to buy dresses, two piece garments and shoes for children

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo y su esposa son personas emprendedoras y muy trabajadoras, ambos tienen sus propios negocios la esposa es dueña de un Copetín Comedor, y el Señor trabaja como vendedor independiente, comercializando todo tipo de productos alimenticios, de consumo, bebidas en general y demás. 
Él es una persona que con dedicación y lucha está tratando de mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Comenta que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos alimenticios varios, bebidas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Alfredo and his wife are very hardworking and entrepreneurial people. They both have their own businesses. His wife owns a diner, and he is a freelance salesman, selling all kinds of food products, consumer goods, beverages and others. 
He is a devoted person struggling to improve his living conditions. He is asking for this loan to invest in buying several drinks and other food items, and thus be able to continue working the way he's done it so far.

loans.use: to buy food products, consumer goods, beverages and others

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es una estudiante de Administración de Empresas, ella tiene como meta poder ser una buena profesional y estudiar y servir a las personas.
Ella su anterior préstamo lo uso en pagar sus cuotas, y comenta que le ha sido de mucha ayuda. Hoy pide de un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en pagar sus cuotas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a student of Business Administration, she aims to become a great professional and to study and serve her community. 
She used her previous loan is to pay her tuition dues, and says the money had been very helpful. Today, she is asking for a new loan to, once again, use towards paying her fees, so she can continue furthering her career.

loans.use: to pay her college tuition fees.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian es estudiante de Radiología vive con sus padres en la zona de San Lorenzo, ella no trabaja pero le ayuda a su madre atendiendo a los clientes en su negocio y por la tarde estudia en la universidad está cursando el primer año y comenta que su deseo es trabajar en algún centro asistencial y poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella pide este préstamo ya que quiere pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo de seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Lilian is a student of Radiology. She lives with her parents in San Lorenzo. She is not working but she helps her mother tending to her customers in her business during the day, and goes to class in the evenings. This is her first year in school and says she would like to work in a medical center to be able to help others. 
She is asking for this loan to pay for her college dues, and thus be able to continue studying. She is thankful for the opportunity she is getting to keep moving towards her goal.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Henry Octavio

texts.es:
Henry es un hombre honrado y pujante, a sus 50 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos adolescentes y vive en unión libre con su pareja sentimental.
Desde hace 14 años trabaja como comerciante independiente, vendiendo ropa y medias, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y lo inició luego de quedarse desempleado, porque la empresa donde trabajaba hizo corte de personal; desde entonces vio en el trabajo de calle una alternativa para ganarse la vida.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (ropa y medias) esto le permitirá tener más variedad y estilos para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas e ingresos.
Henry sueña con tener un almacén en un local comercial, que le permita mejorar la rentabilidad y tener una estabilidad económica para dar mejor educación a sus hijos y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Henry is an honest and vigorous 50 year old man.  He is the father of two teenagers and lives in a common law marriage.

He has been working as an independent merchant for 14 years, selling clothing and hosiery.  He learned this on his own and started the business when he became unemployed because his company had a personnel cut.  Since then he has been working on the streets to earn a living.

He is asking for this loan to buy inventory in quantity (clothing and hosiery) so he can have a greater variety of styles to satisfy his customer demand and increase his sales and income.

Henry wants to have a store in a local shop so he can increase his profitability and have financial stability so he can provide a better education to his children and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Cristo Rey 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristo Rey 2 está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Marta es una de las integrantes, ella genera los ingresos de su familia gracias a las manualidades que ella hace y que también sale a vender en otros lugares sus productos. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de su trabajo seguir ayudando a su familia y sus seres queridos como lo viene haciendo.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materiales para seguir haciendo sus manualidades y  de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
Cristo Rey 2 group is requesting for their second loan as a women's committee. They live in the city of Concepción, a growing city, further away from the downtown area. It is an area of ​​difficult access, so these members want to work hard to be able to grow and strive to give their area a better environment ans allow it to slowly grow. 
Marta is one of its members. She makes her living and helps her family making and selling her crafts in several locations. She hopes that in time, and through her work, she will continue helping her family and loved ones as she has done it so far. 
She is requesting for this loan to purchase materials to keep working on her craft and to continue growing her business and provide her family with what they need so they can have a life without hardship.

loans.use: Comprar materiales para seguir haciendo manualidades.

loans.name: Pravati

texts.en:
Pravati is 30 years old and a widow living with her father and four-year-old daughter in a small village in Odisha, India. She has been engaged in selling bangles and ladies' personal care products after the death of her husband. Her husband expired in 2009. Pravati's father helps her in her business as he purchases items from the market and gives them to Pravati. Pravati sells her stock in nearby village markets. She earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity. 

She has a plan to take a room for rent and open a variety store where she can sell ladies' personal care products. She has requested a loan to purchase different styles of bangles and other personal care products in bulk. She hopes to make her daughter a teacher. She is happy and grateful to Kiva for this kind help.

loans.use: To purchase different styles of bangles and other personal care products in bulk.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es:
Gaspar tiene 46 años de edad, desafortunadamente no sabe leer ni escribir ya que sus padres no lo mandaron a estudiar a la escuela por la situación económica que vivían, actualmente él está soltero pero en algún tiempo atrás estuvo acompañado y tiene una hija de 10 años como fruto de dicha relación, y en su vivienda solo vive con su padre y su madre.
 
La agricultura, es la actividad a la cual siempre se ha dedicado Gaspar, él realiza la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) esta actividad la aprendió de su padre quien desde pequeño le enseñó a trabajar en el campo, él también trabaja con una máquina picadora de alimento para ganado que también es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos económicos para él y su familia.


El crédito que Gaspar está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo utilizará específicamente para la compra de una vaca lechera, ya que por medio de ella obtendrá alimentos e ingresos para su familia y también que la compra de la vaca era un deseo que tenía desde hace varios años.

 
Sus propósitos a futuro son mejorar su vivienda, pues donde vive actualmente se encuentra muy deteriorada, además le gustaría comprar más vacas lecheras, él siente que el ganado es algo que genera buenos ingresos económicos y piensa que con la ayuda de los créditos puede lograr todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Gaspar is 46 years old and unfortunately cannot read or write because his parents could not send him to school for economic reasons. He is currently single but was previously in a relationship and has a 10-year old daughter as a result of this relationship. He lives in his home with his father and mother.
 
Gaspar has always worked in Agriculture. He plants basic grains (corn and beans) which he learned from his father who taught him from an early age to work in the field. He also works with a mill for cattle feed, work that generates good income for him and his family.


The loan from CrediCampo that Gaspar is requesting will be used specifically for the purchase of a dairy cow. With this he will get food and income for his family. The purchase of the cow is a wish that he has had for several years.

 
His plans for the future are to improve his home.  Where he lives now is in very poor condition.  He also would like to buy more dairy cows. He feels cattle are something that generate good income and thinks that with the help of loan he can accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
20 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción se unieron para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Todas son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalía, está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, la cual en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado bastante gracias a su esfuerzo y sumado a las capacitaciones. 
Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que vende todo tipo de prendas, y que por medio de ese trabajo ayuda a sus seres queridos. Es una mujer muy luchadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, que pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, y de esa forma seguir mejorando su vida, y trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
20 women from the city of Asunción gathered to get ahead and help their families by working together. All of them are the head of their families struggling to get by. 
One of the members is Rosalia is participating in the elimination of poverty survey, where she was qualified as level 3, which means she has improved a lot thanks to her efforts and her joined training sessions. 
She sells a variety of clothing items, and she helps her loved ones with her earnings. She is a fighter and she has an entrepreneurial spirit, and she is asking for this loan to purchase various garments for sale, and thus further improve her life, working as she's always done it.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing items

loans.name: Sahara

texts.en:
Sahara’s literal translation is dawn. And for her husband, she is opening new horizons of hope and financial security. Her husband runs a small bike repair shop in his village of Sankarpur. The family has some land, but it lacks the fertility to produce enough to sustain their basic food requirements.  Their business has the potential to fill the all-important gap. The workshop is located at the railway station, which brings a good crowd to the village, many of them riding bikes.

Apart from doing her domestic works, Sahara is running a small dairy in the backyard of her house. According to the local NGO, which works in the area, Sahara has shown a lot of promise after joining a self-help group in her village. A few years back, Sahara was a different woman. She would stay indoors and be totally consumed by her domestic work.  Her contribution to the household economy was small. But after she joined the group, she became more open and started learning about her surroundings, the challenges her family faces and the opportunities to exploit. 
   
She now seeks a loan to modernize their bike repair shop to attract more customers. She has already used a loan previously from a microfinance institution and repaid it back successfully. She has been consistently working with the local field partner for the last four years and has improved a lot as a micro-entrepreneur. She wants use the additional income for her children’s nutrition and education.

loans.use: to modernize her hudband's bike repair shop

loans.name: Charki

texts.en:
Chittolodiya village is a remote village in Deoghar district. Deoghar town has emerged as a dairy hub in recent years and most of the residents of Chittolodiya started dairy businesses. This village also has a milk chilling plant. 

Charki, 45 years old, is married with four children. She is from Chittolodiya and, following this trend, got into the diary business with a buffalo and a cow. Business is going well and she would like it to grow. That is why she is looking for this loan. She wants to buy one more cow. The risk is minimum since there is so much demand for milk in this area.
 
Charki keeps her animals in a shed next to her house. Her husband helps her sell milk in Deoghar market or to the milk chilling plant. They sell 3-4 litres of milk every day. With this loan, they expect to double their sales.

None of her four sons completed their education. They started working in construction with an income of Rs 200-300/day/person. Charki never went to school but dreams of being a successful dairy entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María, es una mujer soltera, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en Tulcán, Trabajadora y muy amable, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 van a la escuela y colegio, las edades de sus niños son de 13, 11, 8 y 2 años de edad, el ultimo se queda al cuidado de ella. María, hace más de 2 años vive en Ecuador, nació en Colombia pero por motivos de falta de empleo decidió residir en la ciudad de Tulcán, ella se dedica a la preparación de platos como papas asadas acompañadas de pollo asado a la parrilla, o chorizo, o un plato típico de la zona como es la tripa mishqui, que son los intestinos de la res asados, esta ubicada en un barrio donde no tiene competencia siendo la pionera en vender estos platos aquí, por esta razón le ha ido muy bien. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar papas, chorizo, pollo, tripa mishqui para preparar sus platos. Su sueño es tener su propia casa y poder educar a sus hijos para que lleven una buena vida.
texts.en: Maria is 42 years old and lives in Tulcán. She is a single mother of 4 children, 3 of which are in school, ages 13, 11, 8 and 2 years old. The youngest still stays home with her. She is hard working and very friendly. Maria was born in Colombia, but she's lived in Ecuador for 2 years. She had to leave her home country due to lack of employment, so she decided to live in the city of Tulcán. She makes her living preparing meals like baked potatoes and roasted grilled chicken, or chorizo, or mishqui tripe, a local dish made out of roasted beef intestines. There no competition in her neighborhood, which makes her the first woman selling these dishes there, for which she has been very successful. She needs this loan to buy potatoes, chorizo​​, chicken and mishqui tripe to prepare her meals. Her dream is to own a home and be able to educate her children so they can have a good life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chorizo​​, chicken and mishqui tripe to prepare her meals

loans.name: Fulo

texts.en:
Fulo is married and a young mother of two girls who are attending school. She lives in Deosangh village, which is on the outskirts of Deoghar town.  Most of the residents of this village are engaged in construction work in nearby Deoghar town. 

Besides taking care of the house and her daughters, Fulo is responsible for milking her two cows, rearing the five goats they own, and selling the milk in the local market.

Her husband takes on contract work of laying marble and mosaic tiles in houses and commercial establishments. His monthly income is about Rs 7000, but a big part of it is used to rent the mechanized marble cutting machine for his work. Despite all the work of the family, they live in very modest conditions, and their revenue is barely enough for a decent life.
  
Fulo applied for this loan to help her husband’s business. They want to buy a marble cutting machine and save the high rental charges that they are currently paying. They are confident that, with both of them working, they will honor all repayments to lenders.

Fulo dreams of providing the good education to her daughters that she didn't have.

loans.use: to buy a motorized marble cutting machine

loans.name: Aleli Group

texts.es:
El comité Aleli nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar, este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Mirna, presidenta del grupo tiene 31 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora  y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este. Ella se dedica a las ventas varias de todo tipo de productos, es una mujer muy trabajadora que por medio de su trabajo lucha por sus seres queridos ya que quiere darles todo lo que no pudo tener y que no tenga que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar,  fideos, carne,  leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina, etc., y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas, luchando en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Aleli grows out of the management and support of a group of women who are working there. This communal bank is from the city of San Lorenzo. The members have made the growth of each one of them their main goal, in their work as well as personally. 

Señora Mirna, president of the group, is 31 years old.  She is a very enterprising woman, who is capable of leading a group as numerous as this one. She works in various types of sales, selling all kinds of products. She is a very industrious woman, who by means of her work, is fighting for her loved ones, as she wants to give them everything that she was not able to have, so that they will not want for anything. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, beverages, oil, flour, etc., and in this way, continue with her sales, striving in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, noodles, meat, milk, baked goods, rice, beverages, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Lauro Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, es un hombre de 47 años de edad, trabajador, alegre y muy responsable, vive en la ciudad de Tulcán, tiene 3 hijos un niño de 2 años y 2 niñas de 8 y 13 años, los cuales viven con su mama, él vive solo, pero siempre les visita a sus hijos. El es albañil desde ya 35 años atrás. El necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para construir un cerramiento en una casa. Su sueno es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación para que vivan de mejor manera.
texts.en: Antonio, is a 47-year-old worker. He is cheerful and very responsible. He lives in the city of Tulcán. He has 3 children, a 2-year-old boy and 2 girls aged 8 and 13, who live with their mom. He lives alone, but he is always checking on his children. He's been a construction worker for 35 years. He needs this loan to buy tools to start building a home structure. His dream is to own a home and to provide his children with a good education so they can live a better life.

loans.use: to buy tools to start building a home structure

loans.name: Jaime Ulises

texts.es:
Jaime es un joven emprendedor de 24 años, que a pesar de las limitaciones económicas logro estudiar hasta segundo año de bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además de su esposa y su hija, en la vivienda también viven sus padres y una hermana.

Jaime se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y pollos de engorde, ya tiene aproximadamente un año de dedicarse a esta actividad pues él considera que es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos para su familia, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a  un amigo y a una institución que lo capacitó para que pudiera emprender el pequeño proyecto que hoy en día le está dando buenos resultados, aparte de esta actividad también tiene una pequeña tienda en su vivienda que le genera ingresos extras, para poder llegar a las granjas debe hacer un recorrido de un kilómetro desde su casa.


Él necesita muchísimo de este préstamo, pues lo utilizará para la compra de 300 pollas ponedoras de huevos y concentrado para alimentarlas. Él siempre ha querido tener más producción de huevos porque tiene una alta demanda en la zona donde  reside, de esta forma le generará más ingresos para su familia y mejorará su condición de vida.


Jaime desea para el futuro, ampliar sus granjas, tener más producción y poder expandir más sus ventas en otros mercados nacionales, también desea seguir estudiando en el futuro una carrera universitaria junto a su esposa, pues nunca es tarde para retomar los estudios y superarse.
texts.en:
Jaime is a young 24 year old entrepreneur. Despite economic limitations, he studied through the second year of secondary school. He is married and his wife is engaged in the household duties. In addition to his wife and daughter, his parents and sister also live in the home. 

Jaime raises chickens. He has been dedicated to this activity for approximately one year. He believes this is an activity generates good income for his family. He learned this work from a friend. An institution enabled him to undertake a small project which today is giving him good results. In addition to this activity, he also has a small store in his home which generates extra income. In order to reach the farms, he has to travel one kilometer from his house. 

He needs this loan a lot. He will use the loan to purchase 300 laying hens and feed concentrate to feed them. He always wanted to have more egg production because he has a high demand where he lives. He will generate more income from his family and improve their quality of life. 

For the future, Jaime wishes to enlarge his farms, to have more production and to be able to expand his sales more into other national markets. He also wants to continue studying at the university level in the future with his wife. It is never too late to  go back to school and excel.

loans.use: purchase 300 laying hens and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es: Don Juan es un señor que se dedica a la actividad comercial de venta de agua en bolsitas selladas, el  tiene sus propias maquinas para sellar el agua, el cual vende por mayor, siendo este su principal medio de ingresos solicita el crédito para invertir en materia prima como empaque rotulado para la venta de agua. Espera en un futuro comprar una maquina mas para aumentar la producción y seguir mejorando sus ingresos, asi apoyarse mutuamente con su esposa.
texts.en: Juan sells bottled water.  He has his own machine to seal the bottles, which he sells in quantity and this is his main source of income.  He is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as packaging to sell water.  He expects to buy another machine so he can increase his production and income and support himself mutually with his wife.

loans.use: to buy packaging.

loans.name: Mirian Mercedes

texts.es:
Mirian Mercedes, es una mujer estudiante de Enfermería, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir todos sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia. Hola soy Mirian, tengo 31 años de edad, resido en Sainagua, San Cristobal con mi esposo y mis dos hijos.  Mi hogar y la educación de mis hijos dependen de mis ingresos como trabajadora domestica y de los de mi esposo como chofer de un transporte escolar. Es necesario para mi obtener este préstamo porque con los ingresos que percibo en mi familia no puedo costear la carrera de Enfermería en la Universidad Eugenio Maria De Hostos. Esta carrera me ayudaría para dos cosos que he soñado: echar adelante a mis hijos, ser una persona importante en la sociedad, dar un ejemplo a mis hijos de que nuca es tarde para echar hacia adelante.
Sin este fondo no puedo cumplir mis metas ni objetivos, pero tengo fe en que ustedes me ayudaran a echar adelante con la ayuda económica que me pueden ofrecer y de mi parte con el empeño de ser alguien en el mañana y un ejemplo familiar.
texts.en:
Mirian Mercedes is a nursing student. She is requesting a loan in order to cover all of her educational expenses. This is her story. Hello. My name is Mirian. I am 31 years old. I live in Sainagua, San Cristobal with my husband and two children. My home and the education of my children depend on my income as a domestic worker and that of my husband who works a school bus driver. It is necessary for me to obtain this loan because  the income I receive for my family does not cover the nursing degree at the University of  Eugenio Maria De Hostos. This degree would help me with two things I have dreamed about: to get my children ahead, to be an important person in society and to give my children an example that it is never too late to get ahead. 
Without this base, I can not meet my goal or objectives. I have faith that you will help me get ahead with the economic support offered to me and with determination, I will be someone in the future and a family example.

loans.use: cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Sherun

texts.en:
Sherun and her husband are a hardworking couple.  He is a trader of utensils and she, apart from her household jobs, raises cows and sheep. The family has some land, but hardly anything grows on it. The couple works around 16-hours a day to make a living. 

Their village of Sankarpur is quite near to Bhojpur, the town of blacksmiths. The products from this Jharkhand rural belt are quite famous in the neighboring towns of Bihar, West Bengal. Sherun’s husband sells the finished products from Bhojpur in the far away towns and villages of neighboring states. But due to the shortage of cash, he has to make short trips and spend more money on travel.  A better cash flow to buy more goods in bulk will improve his profits as he will be able to cut the costs of transportation.

Sherun is 37 and the mother of two. Throughout the first part of her life, she remained confined to domestic chores. Even after her marriage, nothing much changed initially. And her role to improve the financial landscape in her husband’s family remained minimal. But that started to change after she joined a self-help group and learned various ways a woman can contribute financially to the family. Being part of the self-help group also made her more confident and she started putting her ideas forward to her family on how to achieve better financial security.
  
She now seeks a loan to buy more goods for her husband’s business to make it more cost effective and profitable. She plans to use the additional income for her two children’s education and social security.

loans.use: to purchase more iron household utensils in bulk

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: Yolanda es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 4 y 8 años, el mayor asiste a la escuela,  son 5 años que Yolanda se dedica a  vender ropa en el mercado y por catálogo, dice que le va muy bien en este negocio ya compra al por mayor y así le sale a  bajo costo y al vender su mercadería le queda utilidad, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el campo y también es albañil, con el crédito va a comprar mercadería en ropa para ofrecerla en el mercado a sus clientes, el sueño de Yolanda es mejorar sus ingresos para terminar  de pagar de su casa y poder darles a sus hijos todo lo necesario para que estudien.
texts.en: Yolanda is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children who are four and eight years old. The older child attends school. Yolanda has sold clothing in the market and through catalogs for five years. She says that this business is going very well since she buys wholesale items. She sells them at low prices and retain earnings. Her husband works on farms and he also is a construction worker. With this loan, she will purchase clothing  to sell in markets. Yolanda's dream is to improve her income so that she can finish paying for her house and give her children everything necessary for their studies.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Serila

texts.en:
Serila, age 35, lives in Jarmundi village, Dumka, Jharkhand, where the famous Basukinath temple is located.  It is a place of pilgrimage for Hindus. Serila is married and the mother of four children. One of the children is married while the others go to school. Including other close relatives, there are 10 family members living at Serila’s home. 

Serila and her husband have been in the spice trading business for the past 10 years. They sell spices at the Jarmundi market twice a week and they also travel to nearby villages markets, working full time six days a week.

Life has been hard for Serila, especially last year when her husband was admitted to the hospital. But she kept working hard and had help from MESP, a local NGO, that provided her with a prior loan that Serila paid back with no major problems. MESP also helped her to open a bank account and encouraged her to save. Financial inclusion is part of MESP goals.

Serila is now requesting a second loan of INR 10,000 to improve their spice business by buying different varieties of spices in bulk, which will bring them more profit. This business is their main source of income. They make Rs 4,000-5,000 a month.

Serila is illiterate but hopes to give good education to her children and see them succeed in life. She is thankful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy spices in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a gas cooking package

loans.name: Dúo Del Valle Group

texts.es:
DUO DEL VALLE
La señora Inocenta de 78 años, soltera,  desde hace  35 años  posee una Tortillería ubicada en Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña  Inocenta es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz y Leña para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
DEL VALLE DUO

Inocenta is 78 years old. She is single and has made tortillas for 35 years. Her tortilla business is located in Chimaltenango. With her hard work she was able to establish and improve her housing, With her business, she has supported herself and gotten her family ahead.

Inocenta dream is to be able to improve her family's quality of life through the micro-loan that she she is asking FAPE for. With the loan, she wants to buy corn and firewood to keep growing her tortilla business.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Nurjahan

texts.en:
Nurjahan, 46 years old, is from a minority community in Sankarpur, Deoghar, Jharkhand. She is married and has a daughter and three sons. Nurjahan never went to school. Her village is near a railway station stop and her husband started a stationery shop, as it is a very viable location for businesses. 

Nurjahan is a housewife and takes care of their animals: a cow and two goats. She also helps her husband with their shop. 

Since Nurjahan joined a Self-Help Group (SHG) a few years ago, she feels empowered and like other women in these groups nowadays, they are the ones making the important decisions regarding running the family. With the life expectancy of people increasing, the need to generate more income is also increasing. So women like Nurjuhan are looking into self-employment. That’s how her husband started the business. They want to grow their business, which has great potential. For this reason, Nurjuhan is requesting a loan for her husband to buy more stationery materials and have a diverse offer of products in their shop. The loan will help them to generate more income to maintain the family and hope for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina’s business was born out of her personal experience of coming to the US to study English from Brazil.  She used a travel agency in Brazil to help her find accommodations in San Diego, but found that they lacked the personal touch a local agency could offer.  She realized that there were many other international students who come to the US and require these kinds of temporary housing services, and rather than returning to Brazil, Carolina decided to stay in San Diego to help other visiting students get settled in this country.

She launched a full-service temporary housing service company with a passion to connect international students and executives with training opportunities in the US.  Her company helps students from all over the world including Brazil, China, Japan, Korea and Spain.  It not only provides furnished accommodations, but has developed partnership with local universities to directly offer English classes and corporate executive training courses. 

Priding herself on creating a personalized experience, Carolina makes an effort to get to know her clients and does whatever she can to meet their needs.  She personally inspects every home that she places students in and refuses to place anyone in a home that she personally would not sleep in.

“This is really a 24-7 job,” said Carolina.  “The international students I work with sometimes call me at midnight asking for my help.”

The biggest challenge that Carolina faces is the seasonal nature of her business.  Cash flow is slow during low seasons, though the workload does not decrease.  She will use her $10,000 Kiva loan to stabilize her cash flow, as well as hire two part-time employees to assist her in operations.  

In the future, Carolina hopes to expand her business to service other college towns such as Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Berkeley, helping more international students discover a warm welcome to the United States.

Check out Carolina’s business on the web at: http://www.andrettosolutions.com

loans.use: to stabilize her cash flow and hire two part-time employees .

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer separada de su marido, con 38 años de edad ella tiene una hija de 20 años y un hijo de 14 años el que asiste al colegio y la hija deseaba ir a la universidad pero no lo hizo debido a la falta de recursos  económicos, Rosa se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace ya 21 años, y agrega que también se dedica a cuidar una niña por la que le pagan y así obtiene otro ingreso,  el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa para ofrecerla en la feria de la ciudad, lo que ella aspira es lograr contar con el dinero suficiente para que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a woman who is separated from her husband. She is 38 years old and has a 20 year old daughter and a 14 year old son who is in high school. Her daughter wanted to go to college, but did not, due to a lack of economic resources.

Rosa has worked in the clothing business for 21 years now. She adds that she also works taking care of a young girl, for which she is paid and therefore gets additional income. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of clothing merchandise to sell in the city market. Her aspiration is to have enough money for her children to stay in school.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Enung

texts.en:
Enung runs a small stall where she sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits and also processes bill payments. She lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Enung is married.

Enung began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business. For the last month, she has had around $300 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

She took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to buy a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Shyama

texts.en:
Shyama is into the dairy business. She and her family have two buffaloes and two cows.

Shyama is from Chittolodiya, a remote village in the District of Deoghar, Jharkhand. She is 44, married with four children, three of whom go to public school and the oldest is doing service. They have their own house and, by working very hard, they were able to buy a bicycle and a TV set, but their home is very simple with very little furniture.

In their village, most people are into the dairy business because the nearby town of Deoghar has a very high demand for milk and some milk plants set up business in the district. Those who work hard can be successful dairy entrepreneurs.

Shyama is tougher than she looks. She takes care of the house and the children's education along with the dairy business. Her husband is also working 
on their dairy farm. It is their only source of income.

She is applying for this loan to buy more cows and buffaloes. She is determined to work hard and generate more profits to provide her family a better life. Shyama had a previous loan from the local NGO “MESP” and opened a bank account as part as the financial literacy provided by MESP. Her credit record is exemplary and she is learning about the importance of savings.

loans.use: to buy cows for the dairy

loans.name: Aref

texts.en:
Aref is a 35-year-old married man with three children living with him in Taiz, Yemen. Although Aref has a university certificate, he couldn’t find a job because of Yemen's economic situation where the unemployment rate increases day after day. Aref decided not to wait for years to get a job either in the public or private sector. Instead, he worked very hard in order to begin his own business. At first, he collected used metal materials and resold them to the metal factory for eight years. Year by year, he improved his business and opened a small construction supplies store. Over time, the store has become bigger and bigger. Now, he is earning a good profit, but it is really not enough to purchase more construction supplies. Most of what he earns goes to the rent for the store and the rest goes to the expenses of his family. Therefore, Aref applied for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to expand his store.

Aref looks forward to increasing his capital and becoming a wholesale dealer. His dreams are to provide his family with a better future and send his children to a private school to receive a better education.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to expand his business

loans.name: Jahari

texts.en:
Jahari is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Deosangh, Deoghar, Jharkhand. She is married and a mother of four sons. Two of her sons are mosaic craftsman while the other two go to school.

Most of the people of this village are engaged in mosaic work. This work is the art of creating images from an assemblage of small pieces of colored glass, stone, marble or other material for the floors. Jahari’s two sons are engaged in this business. They work in Deoghar town because this town is growing fast, so the demand for construction sector is rising. 

Jahari has taken a loan from the local NGO called “MESP” to purchase a different kind of marble cutting machine. She has successfully paid back her first loan. Now Jahari is seeking a loan INR of 12,000/- to purchase a marble cutting machine. She believes this will allow her sons to be more creative and create designs that can fetch better market prices and gradually they can expand their business.   

She thinks the loan will improve her life. Jahari will use the anticipated profits to establish her future.

loans.use: to buy a motorized marble cutting machine

loans.name: Lissex Cecilia

texts.es:
Lissex vive en la ciudad de Chincha, es una joven de condición humilde y sobre todo de trato amable, ha atravesado por muchas momentos difíciles, pero ello no la ha derrotado, logro estudiar una carrera técnica de costura en un instituto de su ciudad y gracias a ello trabaja en una empresa textil de su ciudad como operaria de costura, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para poder salir adelante día a día.

Lissex esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá solventar algunos gastos personales y comprar una máquina de coser para poder poner mejorar su negocio de costura en su vivienda, el cual atiende en sus días libres, así ella seguirá esforzándose por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un gran taller de costura”.
texts.en:
Lissex lives in the city of Chincha. She is a young woman who comes from humble beginnings, but above all, she treats everyone in a friendly manner. Lissex has gone through many difficult moments, but she has never allowed herself to become discouraged. She studied for a technical degree in sewing at an institute in the city. Thanks to her training, she now works at a textile company in the city as a sewing machine operator. This enables her to generate an income so that she can get ahead each day.

Lissex is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support they have provided, she will be able to pay for a few personal expenses and also purchase a sewing machine so that she can improve her sewing business at home that she operates on the days she has free. Lissex continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of having a large sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to pay a few personal expenses.

loans.name: Komezibikorwa Group

texts.fr:
Komezibikorwa est un groupe de 19 personnes.Le mari de la cliente Ildégonde(côté droit de la photo, la première personne qui commence la troisième ligne), a été photographié par erreur.
Emelyne fait partie du groupe  Komezibikorwa et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée  à Moise, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés   de 3 à  20  ans.

Elle fait le commerce de  tomates, ananas, oranges,…  depuis 15 ans. 

Elle est  à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’oranges, d’ananas, de tomates,… à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Komezibikorwa is a group of 19 people. The husband of member Ildégonde (right side of the photo, the first person who begins the third line), was photographed by error.

Emelyne belongs to the Komezibikorwa group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 35 years old and is married to Moses, a driver. Together they have seven children whose ages range from three to 20 years. 

She has been trading tomatoes, pineapples, and oranges for the past 15 years. 

She is on her second credit loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of oranges, pineapples, and tomatoes for resale, to earn more. 

In coming years she would like to buy a plot of land and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of oranges, pineapples, and tomatoes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Ankato-Allama Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  ANKATO-ALLAMA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme DJENEBOU (2ème sur la photo de la  gauche vers  la droite) compte acheter avec son prêt 3 colis de friandises. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché, à la maison et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA et à BAMAKO. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Ankato-Allama group are married women who on average are 32 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Kolondieba, one of the districts in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their sixth loan with the institution and fully intend to reimburse it.

Ms. Djenebou (second on the photo from left to right) will use her loan to buy three packages of candy. She sells daily at the market and from her home, and is quite in demand, especially on market fair days. She gets her supplies in Kolondieba and Bamako, and sells for cash and sometimes on credit to a mixed clientele. 

She hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 25,000 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Buy candy

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   DANAYA   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAMBA, commune de KEBILA une des Sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme   RAMATOU B   (1ère assise sur la natte  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche) compte acheter avec son prêt 2 sacs de mil pour faire du couscous. Elle vend à SAMBA et environnant en espèces à une clientèle mixte et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à KOUALE et à KEBILA.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.500FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are married women who on average are 36 years old with five children, all living in polygamous families in Samba, part of the Kebila township, one of the sub-districts in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their first loan with the institution and intend to reimburse it in full.

Ms. Ramatou B. (first person sitting on the mat from right to left in the photo) will use her loan to buy two bags of millet to make couscous. She sells in Samba and the surrounding area, for cash to a mixed clientele. She is very sought after, especially on market fair days. She resupplies in Kouale and Kebila.

She hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 10,500 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses

loans.use: buy millet

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   DJIGUISSEME   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAMBA, commune de KEBILA  une des Sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme   AWA   (2ème sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) compte acheter avec son prêt 1 sac de farine. Elle vend à SAMBA et environnant en espèces à une clientèle mixte et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à KOUALE et KEBILA.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9.500FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguisseme group are married women who on average are 35 years old with three children, all living in polygamous families in Samba, in the Kebila townshp, one of the sub-prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their first loan with the institution and intend to reimburse it in full.

Ms. Awa (second on the photo from right to left) will use her loan to buy one bag of flour. She sells in Samba and the surrounding area, for cash to a mixed clientele, and is quite in demand, especially on market fair days. She resupplies in Kouale and Kebila.

She hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 9,500 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses

loans.use: buy flour

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SIGUIDIA   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAMBA, commune de KEBILA une des Sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme   SOKOURA   (1ère sur la photo de la droite à la gauche) compte acheter avec son prêt 100 kilogrammes de mil pour le couscous. Elle vend à SAMBA et environnant en espèces à une clientèle mixte et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à KOUALE et  à KEBILA.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguida group are married women who on average are 43 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Samba, in the Kebila townshp, one of the sub-prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their third loan with the institution and intend to reimburse it in full.

Ms. Sokoura (first person on the photo from right to left) will use her loan to buy 100 kilos of mil to make couscous. She sells in Samba and the surrounding area, for cash to a mixed clientele, and is quite in demand, especially on market fair days. She resupplies in Kouale and Kebila.

She hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 5,000 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses

loans.use: buy millet to make couscous

loans.name: Dúo Rabinal Group

texts.es:
DUO RABINAL 
Conformado por Pedro,  quien tiene 38 años y es padre de 5 niños los cuales todos estudian en una escuela publica de la comunidad,  Pedro se dedica a la  venta de verduras  las cuales las compra por mayor para poder brindar mejores precios a sus clientes.
 Dentro de los sueños y anhelos de  Pedro  es que cada uno de sus hijos culminen sus estudios y que cada uno pueda adquirir un negocio para que ellos puedan tener un mejor estilo de vida   es por eso que acude a KIVA para poder adquirir un crédito el cual desea invertir en su venta de verdura  y poder tener variedad  para ofrecerle a sus clientes
texts.en:
“Rabinal” Group

This group includes Pedro, who is 38 years old. He is the father of five children, all of whom attend a public school in the community. Pedro sells vegetables that he buys in bulk, which allows him to offer the best prices to his customers.

Among his dreams and wishes is seeing his children finish their studies so that each one can acquire a business in order that all of them can have a better lifestyle. For this reason, he approached Kiva about acquiring a loan. He wants to invest in his business of selling vegetables so that he can have a variety that he can offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yury Aracely

texts.es:
Yury es una joven de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, pues quedó embarazada a temprana edad y eso no le permitió continuar sus estudios, es madre soltera y vive con sus padres un hermano y dos hermanas.


Esta joven se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, ya tiene 3 años dedicándose a esta actividad gracias a una tía que la invitó a que pusiera su propio negocio, la actividad  le genera buenos ingresos económicos para ella y su familia, el negocio lo tiene en su casa y en algunos momentos le toca salir a vender de casa en casa o a los alrededores de su comunidad, ella sale por la mañana y regresa por la tarde, prácticamente es una actividad de todo el día pero comenta que vale la pena porque le genera buenas ganancias, en este trabajo se involucra una hermana suya.



El préstamo lo utilizará para invertirlo en el negocio de venta de ropa, tener más variedad de ropa para sus cliente y poderles ofrecer un mejor servicio, específicamente ella comprará ropa para dama pues es lo que más necesita su negocio. La inversión del crédito le permitirá atraer más clientes a su tienda, ofrecer más variedad, un buen servicio y bajos precios, ya que es madre soltera y no le puede faltar lo necesario a su hijo.

En primer lugar Yury desea seguir estudiando, sacar una carrera universitaria, seguir ampliando  su negocio de venta de ropa y tener un local propio para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Yury is a young woman of 23. She studied up to first year of college but became pregnant and couldn't complete her studies. She is a single mother and lives with her parents, a brother and two sisters.

Yury has earned her living selling men's, women's, and children's clothing for three years thanks to an aunt who invited her to open her own business. She earns good money to support herself and her family. The business is run out of her home and she also sells from door to door in the local community. Yury leaves the house in the morning and returns in the afternoon. Really it takes up most of the day, but it's worth it because it generates a good income. One of her sisters is also involved in the business.

Yury plans to invest the loan money in her business. She wants to have a greater variety of clothing to offer her customers, specifically women's clothing which she is most in need of. The investment will allow her to attract more customers to her store, provide a wider variety of clothing, offer better service and lower prices. As a single mother, she wants to provide all the necessities for her son.

In the future Yury wants to continue her studies, complete university, expand her business, and have her own premises where she can provide better service.

loans.use: Buy women's clothing and expand her business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 25-year-old young woman living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. She is married with one child. Pauline is an aspiring entrepreneur who inspires other women in her community to be financially independent. She started her poultry business in 2010 after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens in her community. She currently produces about 200 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers.

Pauline knows that she could sell more chickens each month if she used her current profits to buy more supplies. However, almost all of her income is currently needed to provide for her child who is dependent upon her. With this Kiva loan she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her child and put her child through school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and feed

loans.name: Farirai

texts.en:
Farirai is a 28-year-old married woman with 2 children. She is living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe.  She volunteers in schools in her community, offering guidance and support to students through life skills education. Over the last year, she has been running a poultry business – producing about 150 broiler birds every 6 weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2013 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Farirai would very much like to increase her sales volumes and become a supplier to major supermarkets such as Food World. Farirai will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will enable her to cater to her children’s needs as well as pay school fees for her 2 siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   TIESSIRI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAMBA, commune de KEBILA une des Sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme CHITAN   (1ère sur la photo de la droite à la gauche) compte acheter avec son prêt 1 panier de poissons. Elle vend à SAMBA et environnant en espèces à une clientèle mixte.Elle s’approvisionne à KOUALE et à KEBILA.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Tiessiri group are married women who on average are 41 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Samba, in the Kebila townshp, one of the sub-prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their third loan with the institution and intend to reimburse it in full.

Ms. Chitan (first person from right to left in the photo) will use her loan to buy one basket of fish. She sells in Samba and the surrounding area, for cash to a mixed clientele. She resupplies in Kouale and Kebila.

She hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 5,000 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 34-year-old business woman. She is married with three children and residing in Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe. She is well-known as a pillar of support for vulnerable children and a source of inspiration for young rural women in the community. She volunteers as a Camfed Core Trainer in her community, leading a group of young women dedicated to improving the well being of students and keeping them in school. In addition, Tsitsi runs a small flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for 9 years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Tsitsi will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her further education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Margareth

texts.en:
Margareth is 24 years old and lives in the Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe. She is married and a mother of one. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school. Margareth is currently running a poultry business which she started in September 2013. On average, she produces about 150 birds every six weeks and sells them to the community. Margaret is very proud of the business and would love to expand it. 
The Kiva loan will enable her to purchase more chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her to increase profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and stock feed

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a 28-year-old woman and a mother of two. She is married and currently lives in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner guide, working to improve the learning environment of students by teaching them about wellbeing. She is a vivacious woman who cares about the health and welfare of her community.

Blessing is currently renting a table at the local flea market where she sells men’s and women’s clothes such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, jackets, and jerseys to local residents. She started this business in 2012 because she wanted to provide for her children and improve her standard of living. She did not want to depend solely on her husband and for this reason she decided to start buying small bales of second-hand clothes and selling them to the rural community at an affordable price. Now she sells new clothes at a local flea market as well.

Blessing intends to use the Kiva loan to increase her stock. She has employed one sales person to assist her in her business because her hope is to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is a 20-year-old single young woman living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. Nyasha is an aspiring entrepreneur who inspires other women in her community to be financially independent and be role models in her community. She started her poultry business in 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens. She currently produces about 100 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers.  

Nyasha knows that she could sell more chickens each month if she used her current profits to buy more supplies. However, almost all of her income is currently needed to provide for siblings who are dependent upon her.
