With this Kiva loan, she intends to increase her production capacity by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to improve sales. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Dephine

texts.en:
20-year-old Dephine is a flourishing entrepreneur. She currently resides in Muzarabani District, Zimbabwe where she operates a flea market at the local business center selling cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts, bags, and shoes. She started her business with savings she made as a part-time farm laborer. Dephine inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students about their wellbeing and as an entrepreneur. 

Dephine will use the Kiva loan to increase her stock and improve sales by purchasing more cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 22-year-old mother of one, currently living in Nyanga, Zimbabwe. She actively participates in health campaigns and assists Community Health Trainers when they hold their sessions in the community. She inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students life skills and as an entrepreneur. Currently, Tsitsi is renting a table at the local flea market where she is selling products such as jackets, shirts, and shoes. She started the business when she finished school and she is very proud of how far she has come.

She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more products such as skirts, shorts, children’s clothes, shoes, bags and other accessories so as to increase her stock levels. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: To purchase more skirts, shorts, children’s clothes, shoes, bags and other accessories

loans.name: Ruramai

texts.en:
Ruramai is 27 years old. She is married with two children and is residing in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools working to improve the well being of students. In addition, Ruramai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for eleven months now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the loan, Ruramai will increase her stock by purchasing more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to create employment in her community as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, track suits, and t-shirts

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is 30 years old, married with two children and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She is well-known for her farming and she volunteers at local schools for agriculture projects. She has been successfully running a potato farming business with additional garden produce that is sold at the market.
 
Nyasha will use the Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and seed potatoes. She really loves farming and hopes to become a well-established and recognized supplier of potatoes. When the business expands, she will use the returns to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase more seed potatoes

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lilian is an 18-year-old young business woman living in Muzarabani, Zimbabwe. She currently runs her own grocery shop where she sells food items such as cornmeal, cooking oil, and beans. Lilian inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for a year now and has managed to employ one additional person. 

Lilian will use this Kiva loan to expand her business and hire additional community members. She wants to employ people in the community and better provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to increase stock, expand the business, and hire additional community members

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock of food supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Colleta is a 20-year-old young woman. She is single and lives in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Colleta has the opportunity to volunteer with schools in her community, helping students gain life skills. She is currently operating a buying and selling business to local residents selling clothing accessories such as children’s dresses, shirts, skirts, lingerie, as well as shoes. She started the business in 2013 because she wanted to be financially independent.

Colleta would very much like to increase her sales and become a key supplier to major supermarkets. Colleta will use the Kiva loan to purchase more clothes for her business to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business to increase her stock

loans.name: Pretender

texts.en:
Pretender is a 22 years old, single, and has one child. She currently lives in Nyanga, Zimbabwe. Pretender volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students about their well being in local schools. She is currently running a flea market where she sells various clothing accessories such as trousers, shirts, skirts, blouses, children’s clothes, bags, and shoes. She started the business in 2012 and has been providing for her child through the income from the business. 

Pretender requested a loan, which she will use to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes to increase her supplies. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well being.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes

loans.name: Gracious

texts.en:
Gracious is a 21-year-old single mother of one currently living in Nyanga, Zimbabwe. She sells cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts and shoes at the local business center. 

Gracious inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students about their wellbeing, and as an entrepreneur. She started the business in 2013 when she finished school so that she could provide for herself. 

Gracious will use the Kiva loan to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes to increase her supplies. 

An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a 20-year-old young woman living in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. Yvonne volunteers by assisting Community Health Trainers fight against HIV and AIDS, as well as poverty. She is renting a stall at a flea market where she sells shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans, and lady’s tops. Yvonne started the business when she finished school one year ago as a way to support her family. The business has enabled her to improve her current standard of living. 

With the Kiva loan, Yvonne will increase her stock of clothing, which will yield a higher sales volume. An improvement in the business means she will be able to further her education and pay her way through school.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 31 years old, and married with three children. She currently resides in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students valuable life skills, and as a Community Health trainer. 

Sharon started her poultry business in 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for chickens and saw it as an opportunity. She currently produces about 150 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers.  

Sharon knows that she could sell more chickens each month.  But all her income is needed to provide for two children, who are dependent upon her, so she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.  With a Kiva loan investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her children and keep them in school.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 22 years old and lives in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide who enhances student knowledge of study and life skills, and as an entrepreneur. She started her poultry business in January 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for chickens, and saw it as an opportunity. She currently produces about 120 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers.  

Martha knows that with this Kiva loan she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With a Kiva investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to further her education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a 20-year-old young woman, currently residing in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. She is a well-known volunteer in her community who works to keep children in school. She is renting a stall at a flea market where she sells shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans, and ladies' tops. By running the business for the past two years after she completed school, Sylvia has been able to support her two siblings' needs as well as pay their school fees.

With the Kiva loan, Silvia will increase her stock of clothing in order to increase her sales volume. An improvement in the business means she will be able to keep her siblings in school.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Marvellous

texts.en:
Marvellous is a 24-year-old single young woman who lives in the District of Muzarabani in Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools disseminating health information to students. Marvellous also runs a flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2012 to support her three siblings, as she is the main breadwinner in the family. 

She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand. The Kiva loan will enable her to get more jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and continue supporting her siblings.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Maudy

texts.en:
Maudy is a 20-year-old single young woman living in Muzarabani, a district in Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools, teaching students life skills education. Maudy inspires young women in her community to become entrepreneurs.

Maudy currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items to her community, such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mielie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. Maudy will use the Kiva loan to stock up her shop. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to increase stock and increase profitability.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 24-year-old young woman living in Muzarabani District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, working with students at local schools to help improve their study skills. Additionally, she offers psychosocial support to young people in her community. 

Mildred’s hard work and ambition led her to own and run a shop in a local business center where she sells clothing accessories and shoes. She started the business in 2011 when she was married and started facing financial difficulties. Currently, Mildred's profits barely meet her family’s needs.
  
With a Kiva loan, Mildred will increase her stock and expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for herself. Her hope is to grow the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to increase her stock and expand her business and profits

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 30-years-old and married with two children. She lives in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. Patience is a committed volunteer health trainer in her community where she disseminates health information and actively fights against the spread of HIV/AIDS. In addition, Patience is currently running her own business at a local flea market where she sells shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans, and lady’s tops. Patience inspires school children as a community health trainer and as an entrepreneur who is self-reliant and economically independent. She has been running her own business for four years and has managed to support her family.
 
With the Kiva loan, Patience will increase the amount of shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans and lady’s tops which will in turn increase her sales. This will allow her to pay school fees for both her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of more clothes

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. She is 38 years old and married with two children. Evelyn is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as new and second-hand shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and blankets to the community. She has been running this business for three years now and it has enabled her to support her family. When she is not busy selling items at her stall, Evelyn is actively encouraging young women in her rural community to seek economic empowerment. 
 
With the Kiva loan, Evelyn plans to increase her stock and improve sales. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her children’s education, as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Esnath

texts.en:
Esnath is a 32-year-old mother of five currently living in Chikomba West, Zimbabwe. She is devoted to helping her community fight HIV/AIDS by spreading health information to school children and community members. Over the last two years, Esnath has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 200 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She is very proud of her business as it makes her a financially independent woman. 

Esnath will use the Kiva loan to increase her productive capacity through purchasing more broiler chicks and chick feed. By expanding her business, she will be able to create employment in her community by offering jobs to the unemployed. She hopes to provide for her five children.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 34-year-old woman with three children living in Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe where she provides counseling services to young people facing challenges at a local community centre as well as assisting the elderly in her community. She currently operates a mobile grocery business where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, dried fish, biscuits, sweets and other snacks. Young girls in her community remark that they are inspired by Emily, who has shown that women can run their own businesses. 

Emily will use the Kiva loan to expand her mobile grocery business by increasing her stock. She believes that with the additional stock, she will greatly increase her profits and give her the financial freedom to support her children and vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her stock

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is a 29-year old single mother of one living in Chikomba West, a district in Zimbabwe. She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges at a local community center. Nyasha also inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary. She has been running her business for 11 months now and has managed to employ two people during that time. 

Nyasha will use the loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Dzidzai

texts.en:
Dzidzai is 28 years old and lives in the Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe. She is married and has three children. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively leading a group of young women who strive to keep children in school. She runs a family poultry business she started with her husband in 2009. She produces about 200 broiler chickens every six weeks, which enables her to provide for the basic needs of her family. She loves her business and hopes to expand it. 

Dzidzai will use the Kiva loan to purchase chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her to increase profits to pay school fees for her three children.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed and broiler chicks

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 28-year-old mother of three living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women through volunteering in schools as a janitor and an entrepreneur. She started her poultry business in 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens. Gladys currently produces about 120 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers.  

Gladys knows that she could sell more chickens, thus, expanding her business. With this Kiva loan, she will grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to better care for her children and keep them in school.

loans.use: To buy  more chicks and stock feed.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emelda is a 30-year-old mother of four who lives in the Chikomba District of Zimbabwe. She is a successful entrepreneur who inspires other women in her community to become financially independent. Emelda started her poultry business in 2012 after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens. She currently produces about 150 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers. These chickens provide valuable nutrition to the community. 

Emelda knows that she could sell more chickens each month if she used her current profits to buy more supplies. However, almost all of her income is currently needed to provide for her four children who are dependent upon her. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and feed to increase production. Then her profits will increase and she will be able to put her children through school.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Enipher

texts.en:
Enipher is a 29-year-old young woman with two children living in Chikomba District in Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a counsellor and janitor at local schools in her community. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, actively working to improve the well being of children at local schools. Enipher currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as salt, cornmeal, sugar beans, cooking oil, sugar, dried fish, biscuits, sweets and stationary.
 
Enipher  has requested this Kiva loan to buy more supplies so she will have more items to sell at her grocery shop. The resulting additional income will allow her to take better care of her two children. Enipher, who started her enterprise to empower herself economically and earn a stable income, inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Spiwe

texts.en:
Spiwe is a 27-year-old mother of three living in the Chikomba District of Zimbabwe. Spiwe inspires many mothers in her community by showing them that it is possible to be financially independent, and to able to take care of family and children on your own if necessary. She started her poultry business in April 2013 after separating from her husband. She currently produces about 120 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers.  

Spiwe knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all her income is needed to provide for three children, she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. By growing her business, she will be able to live a more comfortable life and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Memory

texts.en: Memory is a 19-year-old single young woman living in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She is an entrepreneur who inspires other women in her community to be financially independent. Memory is currently running a poultry business, but it can barely sustain her. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to improve her current standard of living as well as further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en: Tinei is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the District of Muzarabani in Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools disseminating health information to students. Tinei also runs a flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2013 to support her three siblings and she is the main breadwinner in the family. She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand. The Kiva loan will enable her to get more jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and continue supporting her siblings.

loans.use: to purshase more wares for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chick feed, broiler concentrate and fencing to increase production

loans.name: Sibongile

texts.en:
Sibongile is 18 years old and resides in Muzarabani District, Zimbabwe and is known for her volunteer work at community centers. She is a pillar of support for vulnerable children in the community and also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools to improve the well-being of students through life skills education as part of Camfed’s My Better World Programme. 

Sibongile is currently running a shop where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, T-shirts, cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.

With the Kiva loan, Sibongile will increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her further education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Shupikai

texts.en:
Shupikai is a 32-year-old widowed mother of three. She resides in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she has the opportunity to work with schools in her community, helping students gain studying and life skills. Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 150 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She opened her business in 2012 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  

Shupikai would very much like to increase her sales and become a major supplier. She will use this Kiva loan to purchase more chick feed, broiler concentrate, and fencing to increase her production. She hopes to earn enough money to put her three children through school.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Vimbai

texts.en:
Vimbai, a 19-year-old woman living in Muzarabani District, Zimbabwe, volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, working with students at local schools to help improve their learning. She also assists the elderly in her community. 

Vimbai’s ambition to become financially independent led her to rent and run a shop in a local commercial center where she sells clothing accessories and shoes. Her current profits barely meet her family’s needs, and she would like to improve her enterprise. Vimbai has requested this loan to purchase large bales of clothing to increase her stock and expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for herself. 

Vimbai's hope is to grow the business and create employment in her community, as well as further her education.

loans.use: to increase her stock and expand her business and profits

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 25-year-old young woman with two children living in Muzarabani, a district in Zimbabwe. She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges at a local schools as well as offers lessons on life skills development. She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. Rhoda inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for four years and has managed to employ two people during that time. 
Rhoda will use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock and purchasing more cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Vriginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 34 years old and lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe with her husband and two children. Virginia is passionate about helping the elderly and working with schools in her community to improve children’s well-being. She rents a table at a local flea market where she sells jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets for a living. She started the business in 2008 after her family started facing economic hardships. She really loves her shop and would like to increase her sales volume in order to expand the business. 

Virginia will use the Kiva loan to purchase a large bale of clothes and shoes to increase her stock. Her proceeds will be used to improve her standard of living and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her stock

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 27-year-old single woman with a passion for improving her community of Chiredzi, Zimbabwe. Gladys actively assists the elderly and less privileged as well as volunteers in schools teaching life skills education. To support herself, she has been running a business selling clothing such as jackets, shirts, shorts, skirts, jerseys, and trousers for the past three years. During this time, she has been able to provide for her family’s needs. 

The Kiva loan will enable her to increase her stock of clothing to sell and in doing so expand her business. An increase in profits would make her desire to create employment in her community a reality.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing to sell and in doing so expand her business.

loans.name: Khesani

texts.en:
Khesani is a 29-year-old single woman living in Chiredzi, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide where she teaches life skills education, leadership and entrepreneurship to students in her community. She is currently running a business selling cell phone minutes for local phone providers.
 
She really loves her business and feels it has the potential to transform into something big. A Kiva loan will help her expand the business because she will be able to purchase a vending machine to sell electronic cell phone calling credit. This will help her reduce the cost of procuring the pay-as-you-go cell phone scratch cards. An improvement in the business means that she will be able to pay for college fees for her two siblings.

loans.use: to purchase a vending machine for electronic calling credit.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is an 18-year-old businesswoman living in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe. Beauty is a well-known volunteer in her community who works to keep children in school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students valuable life skills. Since Beauty finished school in 2013, she has owned and run a flea market stand at the local business centre where she sells clothing, accessories and shoes. The business allows her to be self-reliant, but she earns barely enough to meet her family’s needs.  

With a Kiva loan, Beauty will purchase large bales of clothing to increase her supply and expand her business. This will enable her to better provide for the needs of her family and keep her dream of creating employment opportunities in her community alive.

loans.use: to increase her stock by purchasing more stock

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 25-year-old business woman residing in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe. Viola is a well-known volunteer in her community who works to keep children in school. She owns and runs a flea market stand at the local business centre where she sells clothing, accessories and shoes. Currently, Viola’s profits barely meet her family’s needs and she would like a loan to help improve her business.

With a Kiva loan, Viola will purchase tents, tables and hangers to expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for her family. She hopes to someday grow the business and create employment opportunities in her community.

loans.use: to purchase tents, tables and hangers for her market stand.

loans.name: Cherekedzai

texts.en:
Cherekedzai is a 23-year-old single woman from Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school through life skills development because she believes people should have the information to make informed choices. 

Cherekedzai currently operates a poultry business on her father’s farm which she started after finishing school in 2012. It was at this time that she realized she needed to be financially independent and no longer reliant on her poor parents.  

The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her to increase profits to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To increase her production and boost sales by purchasing more chicks and feed

loans.name: Talent

texts.en:
Talent is a 19-year-old young woman living in Muzarabani, a district in Zimbabwe. She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges at a local community center. She also currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as plastic plates, mugs, bowls, and dishes. Talent inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for four years and has managed to employ two people during that time. 

Talent will use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She intends to purchase melamine (plastic) products that are currently profitable. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 27-year-old mother of two living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. For the past eight months, Jane has rented a stall in the local village center where she sells shirts, shorts, shoes, and lady’s tops. With this business experience, Jane is an enthusiastic volunteer in her community who helps mentor young women in entrepreneurship. 

With this Kiva loan, Jane plans to expand the size and range of merchandise to expand her business and increase profits. She hopes to open her own shop and use the additional income to help her support her children by paying for their school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her stock

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 24 years old and lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools helping students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning. In 2010, when she finished school, Patience started her own business at the local market selling shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets. Her sense of independence and entrepreneurship encouraged her to start her business as a way of reducing her dependence on her family. Patience saw this as an opportunity to create a future for herself. She really loves her business and would like to increase its sales volume in order to expand the business.
 
Patience is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets to increase her supplies. She intends to use the proceeds to improve her living standards and through the expansion of the business create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Betina

texts.en:
Betina lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a 21-year-old single entrepreneur and is a very active volunteer in local schools where she organizes and heads school clean-up campaigns as well as donates stationary and pays school fees for some of the orphans and vulnerable children in the community. Betina is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and blankets to the community. She has been running this business for seven years now and it has enabled her to support her family. 
 
With the Kiva loan Betina plans to purchase shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, pants, skirts, baby clothes and blankets to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs and further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Vhenekai

texts.en:
Vhenekai is 35 years old, married with two children. She is currently residing in the rural Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. As a committed volunteer in her community, Vhenekai actively helps to keep children in school through life skills development classes because she believes that they have a chance in life when they make informed choices. To support herself, Vhenekai is currently operating a poultry business, which she started in 2012 and has been running for two years. She started the poultry business as a joint venture with a friend in 2011. The following year Vhenekai moved away from her friend in order to live with her husband in his hometown. Using the skills she had learned during her first business with her friend, she then decided to start her own poultry business in her new town. 

A loan from Kiva will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her increase profits to pay school fees for her two children.

loans.use: to purchase chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a 32-year-old business woman and a mother of two. She lives in the Chiredza district of Zimbabwe where she is a well-known volunteer who works to keep children in school. To earn an income, Silvia owns and runs a flea market stand at the local business center where she sells clothing accessories such as football jerseys, shirts, skirts, jeans, and shoes. She started the business when she got married as a project to help sustain her and her family. However, Silvia’s profits barely meet her family’s needs.  

With a Kiva loan, Silvia will purchase large bales of clothing to increase her merchandise selection and expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for children’s needs as well as for herself. She hopes to someday grow the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en:
Rumbidzai is a 26-year-old businesswoman who is married with two children. She rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products, such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year, and it has enabled her to support her family in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Rumbidzai also serves as a role model for her community as she is well-known for supporting vulnerable children and for her volunteer work at community centers. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Rumbidzai will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her children’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Sekai

texts.en:
Sekai is 21 years old and married with one child. She currently lives in Chiredzi, Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Camed Learner Guide, teaching students life skills. Sekai is very committed to her community as she actively encourages attendance and retention of children in school through home visits and life skills development. 

Sekai also rents a shop at the local flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2013 in order to support herself and her child. Sekai is very pleased with what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand it. 

The Kiva loan will assist her to stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue to support her child’s education.

loans.use: to stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Axcillia

texts.en:
Axcillia is a 24-year-old young woman who lives in the town of Chiredzi, Zimbabwe. To be financially independent, she is an aspiring entrepreneur who has been running a home-based hair salon for half a year now. Axcillia acquired training and experience working in her friend’s hair salon. She inspires young women in her community as both a life skills educator and as an entrepreneur. Auxillia would like to expand her business and increase her clientèle base.

A loan from Kiva will enable her to open her own hair salon and purchase a hair dryer, rollers, ceramic iron or tongs and hair products needed in her salon. Her hope is to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and hair products for her salon

loans.name: Dzidzai

texts.en:
Dzidzai is 38 years old and married with one child. She lives in the Chiredzi district of Zimbabwe where she also volunteers in schools as a Camfed Learner Guide where teaching health and life skills education and offering guidance and counselling in local schools. She is currently running a market gardening business which she started in 2012 after she realized that it wasn't enough to teach people about health; Dzidzai wanted to help them eat healthy foods and live healthy lives as well. The business has also allowed her to pay for school fees for her child and provide food for her family. She sells various types of vegetables such as covo, onions, tomatoes, spinach, cassava, sweet potatoes, and carrots in her community. 

Dzidzai sees a good opportunity to grow her business. There are no fruit and vegetable shops in her area, so she dreams of opening her own shop to meet the needs of her community.  She even hopes to hire employees.  This Kiva loan will give her a chance to take her enterprise to the next level by purchasing more seeds and fertilizers for her garden.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizers for her garden

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is a 19-year-old entrepreneur residing in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe.  She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools teaching children life skills education. To support herself, Precious started a market gardening and poultry business when her family started facing financial difficulties. She is currently producing about 50 broiler chickens every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. 

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community and Precious would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major international supermarkets, such as TM and Spar in Zimbabwe. Precious will use the Kiva loan to extend her fowl run and purchase more broiler chicks to increase production. She intends to use the proceeds to further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
At the age of 25, Chipo is already an experienced entrepreneur in Wedza District, Zimbabwe who has five years of experience in the retail industry. Her business is based at a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as handbags, shoes, jeans, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. Her business has enabled her to support her family and send her two children to school.  Chipo also volunteers in schools counseling students and teaching entrepreneurship skills to school graduates. 

With the Kiva loan, Chipo will purchase handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and T-shirts to increase her stock. This will improve her business considerably and take her one step closer to her dream of owning a store one day. This will bring stability to her business that will enable her to secure her children’s education and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 26 years old and lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools helping students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning. To earn an income, Edith sells traditional clothing, shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets at the local market. She started the business in 2013 in order to be financially independent. She really loves her business and would like to increase her sales volume in order to expand the business. 
Edith is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can import traditional clothing and purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets to increase her stock. She intends to use the proceeds to improve her standard of living. Ultimately, Edith hopes to expand the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
19-year-old Pauline is an aspiring entrepreneur vying for economic empowerment. She learned from an early age that she had to rely on herself to survive and has been running a business at the local flea market where she sells men’s and women’s clothes such as T-shirts, jeans, shirts, jackets and jerseys. She currently resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe where she loves encouraging young women to start projects of their own and not sit at home doing nothing since they finished school. 

Pauline will use the Kiva loan to improve her business by increasing her stock level. Pauline aspires to own her own shop one day and be in a position to create employment for community members.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Delight

texts.en: Delight is a 24-year-old woman who lives in the town of Chiredzi, Zimbabwe. She volunteers at a community hostel for girls who walk long distances to go to school. Delight also rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in April of last year as a way of supporting her three siblings since she is the primary breadwinner in her family. Delight is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand it with the help of a loan from Kiva. With the Kiva loan, she will stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to support her three siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
At 37 years of age, Janet is a recently widowed woman living in the Chiredzi District in Zimbabwe with her two children. In 2013, her husband stopped working because of his illness and the family needed more income to pay medical bills and provide for their children. It was at this time that Janet started a business selling shirts, shorts, shoes, and lady’s tops at the local flea market. In addition, she is an enthusiastic volunteer in her community who helps mentor young women in entrepreneurship.  

With this Kiva loan, Janet will expand the size and range of merchandise in order to increase profits. She hopes to open her own shop and use the additional income to support her children and pay for their school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith resides in the town of Chiredzi, Zimbabwe where she volunteers at a community hostel for girls who walk long distances to school. Judith also rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2009 so as to support herself and three siblings since she is the breadwinner of the family. Judith is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like it to expand. 

The Kiva loan will assist her to stock up on jackets, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to support her two children and three siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Laizah

texts.en:
Laizah is a single woman aged 25 living in Chiredzi, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a trainer of young women on life skills education, leadership, and entrepreneurship. She loves working with children and has also been volunteering for a children’s organization. In order to support herself, Laiza saw the need for a fruit and vegetable stand since there were no other vendors in her village. To capitalize on this opportunity, Laiza started selling fruits and vegetables as well as grocery items in 2012, which has allowed her to be financially independent. 
She really loves her business and she feels it has the potential to transform into something big. A Kiva loan will assist her in expanding her fruit and vegetable business. An improvement in the business means that she will be to cater for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Loreen

texts.en:
Loreen is a 19-year-old entrepreneur residing in Chiredzi District in eastern Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools by organizing clean-up campaigns because she believes that a clean environment offers a healthy and conducive learning environment for children.  Aside from her involvement with the local community, Loreen currently runs a poultry business which she started in January 2013. She produces about 150 broiler chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local residents in her community. She would very much like to increase her sales in order to expand her business.

The Kiva loan will enable her to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and boost her sales. Improving her business will improve her life considerably as she will be able to provide for herself.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Annatolia

texts.en:
Annatolia is a 21-year-old young woman residing in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Annatolia is devoted to helping her community fight against the spread of HIV/AIDS as well as the conditions of poverty in which the disease exists.  To support herself, she is renting a stall at a flea market where she sells shoes, skirts, T-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans and lady’s tops. She has been running the business for four years and has managed to support her family. Annatolia started the business when her husband, who had previously been the breadwinner in the family, passed away. The business has enabled her to provide for herself and her sibling’s needs.

With the Kiva loan, Annatolia plans on increasing her stock of clothing to boost her sales. An improvement in the business means she will be able to keep her siblings in school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her stock

loans.name: Shingairai

texts.en:
Shingairai is a young woman who is married with one child. She lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe and volunteers her cleaning services to the local clinic and schools. Since 2012, she has been running a poultry business from her home and has grown the business to its current capacity – producing about 200 broiler chickens every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. 

Since poultry production is a profitable business in her community, Shingairai would like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her child and her two cousins and put them through school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a single mother of one. She resides in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at schools in her community. The goal of a Camfed Learner Guide is to help boost the academic achievement of students in local high schools and teach life skills. Over the last year she has grown her poultry business to what it is today– producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents.  
Poultry production is a successful business in her community. Abigail would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. Abigail will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed in order to increase production. She will use the proceeds to improve her current standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
19 year old Blessing is a young entrepreneur living in Chiredzi, a district in Zimbabwe. Blessing volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools teaching students life skills. Additionally, she actively promotes youth economic empowerment. To support herself, Blesisng started her own dressmaking business in 2013 when she finished school. She sells a variety of products such as uniforms, duvet covers, clothes, and drapery. 

With the Kiva loan, Blessing will expand her business and open her own clothing shop. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase material such as fabric, sewing needles for her machine, a mannequin and thread. She is passionate about creating employment in her rural community. By improving her business she will also be able to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing material

loans.name: Perceive

texts.en:
Perceive is a single mother of two and an entrepreneur living in Chiredzi, a district in Zimbabwe. Perceive volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools, as well as in the community where she actively promotes youth economic empowerment. She started her own sewing business in November 2013, where she sells a variety of products such as uniforms, children’s dresses, duvet covers, clothes, toilet sets, and drapery. 

With the Kiva loan, Perceive will expand her business and open her own clothing shop. She intends to use the loan to purchase materials such as fabric, sewing needles for her machine, a mannequin, and thread. She is passionate about creating employment in her rural community. By improving her business, she will be able to provide for her family and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 25-year-old young woman living in the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She is married with two children. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at schools in her community. The goal of a Learner Guide is to help boost the academic achievement of students in local high schools as well as teach them life skills. Over the last three months, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing approximately 100 broiler birds every six weeks – while selling to local residents. 

Poultry production is a successful business in her community. Constance is seeking to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use this Kiva loan to purchase more broiler birds and feed in order to increase production. Her hope is to raise enough money to continue her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Plaxedes

texts.en:
19 year old Plaxedes resides in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools teaching students life skills as a part of their education. The Learner Guide program is run by Camfed and supports children’s learning and academic achievement. To support herself, she operates a grocery shop where she sells food such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets and stationary. Shandirai inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for two years and has managed to employ one person during that time. 

Plaxedes intends to use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her supplies. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and for the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks

loans.name: Plaxedes

texts.en:
Plaxedes is a 23-year-old married mother of one. She assists young people in her community through conducting life skills education classes. 

In addition to being a community role model, Plaxedes established her poultry business in August after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens. She currently produces approximately 115 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers.  

Plaxedes knows she could sell more chickens each month if she were able to invest in growing her business. However, all of her income is currently needed to provide for her child who is dependent upon her.

This Kiva loan will enable Plaxedes to expand her business through purchasing more broiler chicks and feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase, and she will be able to continue to care for her child as well as provide access to education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Egness

texts.en:
25-year-old Egness is a young entrepreneur residing in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. Egness is an enthusiastic volunteer in her community who helps mentor young women in entrepreneurship. She is currently operating her own business at a local flea market where she sells shirts, pins, towels, shorts, lady’s tops, and shoes. The business has improved her life considerably and she would love to build upon her success.

With this Kiva loan, Egness plans to grow the size and range of merchandise to expand her business and increase profits. She hopes to open her own shop and use the additional income to continue improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her stock

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a 23-year-old mother of one living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. To help her community, she conducts life skills education classes. 

In addition to being a community role model, she started her poultry business in August after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens. Blessing currently produces about 115 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers.  

Blessing knows that she could sell more chickens each month if she could invest in growing her business. However, all of her income is needed to provide for her child who is dependent upon her. 

With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase, and she will be able to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is a 34-year-old woman living in the Mount Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She is an active volunteer for the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization. She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges in her community.

She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal (coarse flour made from maize), sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, and sweets. Agness inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. 

Agness would use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the amount of stock she has available. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her shop

loans.name: Sue Juliet

texts.en:
Sue is a 19-year-old single young woman living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community to become entrepreneurs in order to achieve financial independence. She began her poultry business after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens within her community. Sue currently produces approximately 120 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers. 

This Kiva loan will enable Sue to expand her business through buying more broiler chicks and feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, Sue’s profits will increase and she will be able to advance her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and feed

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia is 22 years old and lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is passionate about helping the elderly and working with schools in her community to improve children’s wellbeing. Portia rents a table at a local flea market where she sells jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets for a living. She started the business to help improve her living standards. She really loves her business and would like to increase her sales volume in order to expand the business. 
Portia will use the Kiva loan to purchase a large bale of clothes and shoes to increase her stock. Her proceeds will be used to improve her standard of living and create employment in her community. She hopes to own her own boutique one day.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Thiodollar

texts.en:
Thiodollar is 18 years old and lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is very passionate about helping the elderly and working with schools in her community to improve children’s wellbeing. She rents a table at a local flea market where she sells jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets for a living. She started the business in 2013 when she finished school. She really loves her shop and would like to increase her sales volume in order to expand the business. 

Thiodollar will use the Kiva loan to purchase a large bale of clothes and shoes to increase her stock. Her proceeds will be used to improve her living standard and create employment in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks

loans.name: Given

texts.en:
Given is a 24-year-old single young woman living in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe and a mother of one. She is an active volunteer for the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization. She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges in her community and currently operates a grocery shop where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal (coarse flour made from maize), sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, and sweets. Given inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. 

She will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
Chipo is a 21-year-old single woman living in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community to be entrepreneurs so they can become more financially independent.  She started her poultry business in February 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for Rhode Island chickens with lean meat. She is very proud of how far she has come and would love to expand the business.

With this Kiva loan, Chipo will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for herself and continue her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Svodai

texts.en:
Svodai lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. At only 17 years old she is an aspiring entrepreneur. She is very passionate about the environment and demonstrates her passion through involvement in school clean-up campaigns. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide where she teaches life skills education. Svodai is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and blankets to her community. Operating her own business has enabled her to support herself through school.
Svodai plans to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and blankets to increase her stock. Her hope is to expand her business and eventually open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to continue her schooling.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sewing material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
20-year-old Benedict is a young woman living in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She is an aspiring entrepreneur, striving to become economically independent. She inspires young women in her community to be entrepreneurs through her achievements.  She started her poultry business in 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for Rhode Island chickens with lean meat. She currently produces about 120 chickens every 6 weeks and sells them to the local customers. She also sells eggs which she gets from her layers. 

With this Kiva loan, Benedict will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and food to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 26 years old and lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools helping students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning. 

She sells mainly shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets at the local market. She started the business in 2013 when she finished school. Ellen really loves her business. She would like to increase her sales volume and expand the business as a whole. 

Ellen is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes, and jackets to increase her stock. She intends to use the proceeds to improve her living standards and through the expansion of the business, create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
At the age of 19, Rachael is already an experienced entrepreneur in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe and has four years of experience in the retail industry. Her business is based at a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as handbags, shoes, jeans, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. It has enabled her to support her family and send her two children to school.  Rachael also volunteers in schools counseling students and teaching entrepreneurship skills to school graduates. 

With the Kiva loan, Rachael will purchase handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her stock. This would improve her business considerably and take her one step closer to her dream of owning a store one day. This will bring stability to her business that will enable her to secure her children’s education and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Dorren

texts.en:
Doreen lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is 27 years old and married with one child. She is actively involved in Camfed’s Mother Support Groups which assists orphans and vulnerable children in the community. Doreen is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and blankets to the community. She has been operating her business for seven months and it has enabled her to support her family.  
Doreen hopes to expand her business and open her own store. She will use the loan to purchase shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and blankets to increase her stock. Her goals of securing an education for her child as well as meeting her family’s basic needs could soon be realized.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 19-year-old young woman. She is single and lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe.  She volunteers in schools in her community offering guidance and support to students through life skills education. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 150 broiler birds every 6 weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2013 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  
Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Grace would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets such as Food World in Zimbabwe. Grace will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will enable her to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production

loans.name: Kudzai

texts.en:
Kudzai lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is 18 years old and married with one child. She is passionate about helping orphans and vulnerable children in the community. Kudzai volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching young people life skills education. She is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as locks, batteries, shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers and skirts to the community. 
With the Kiva loan, Kudzai will purchase shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and blankets to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. The stability that her business will bring will enable her to secure her child’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and blankets to increase her stock

loans.name: Esria

texts.en:
Esria is a 19-year-old single woman living in the Guruve District of northern Zimbabwe. She is an active volunteer for the Cama network, Camfed’s alumnae organization where she provides counselling services to young people facing challenges in her community. Currently, Esria operates a grocery shop where she sells items such as drinks, snacks, exercise books, pens, rulers, plastic covers, cooking oil, soap, and sugar. Esria inspires young women in her community as a hardworking entrepreneur. 
Esria will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available for purchase. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing the amount of cooking supplies she has available for purchase

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 26-year-old single young woman living with two siblings who are dependent on her in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She started her poultry business in 2011 after noticing an increase in demand for Rhode Island chickens with lean meat. Angeline currently produces about 120 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers. So far, she has been able to employ one person and hopes of hiring more in the future. She inspires young women in her community to be entrepreneurs so they can become financially independent.  
With this Kiva loan, Angeline will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks, and food to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two dependents and keep them in school.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks, and food to increase production

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is a 23-year-old single young woman living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur who owns her own poultry business since 2013 when she noticed an increase in demand for broiler chickens. She currently produces about 200 chickens every six weeks and sells them to the local customers.  

Precious knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all her income is needed to provide for two children who are dependent upon her, she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks, chick feed and organic manure to increase production. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her two children and keep them in school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 33 years old. She currently lives in Guruve, Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a community health trainer and a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students life skills and encouraging attendance and retention of children in school through home visits. Eunice also rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothes, bags and shoes. She started her business in 2010 so as to support herself. She is very pleased with what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand it.
The Kiva loan will assist her to stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Greater

texts.en:
Greater is a 22-year-old single woman living in Guruve, Zimbabwe. Greater actively assists the elderly and less privileged as well as volunteers in schools teaching life skills education. To support herself, she sells clothing accessories such as jackets, shirts, shorts, skirts, jerseys and trousers in the local market. Greater has managed to cater to her family’s needs during the time she has been running the business.

The Kiva loan will enable her to increase the merchandise she has to sell and grow her business. An increase in profits would enable her to expand the business and make her dream of creating employment in her community a reality.

loans.use: to increase her stock and grow her business

loans.name: Patronella

texts.en:
Patronella is a 20-year-old young woman living in Guruve, a district in Zimbabwe. She devotes her time to assisting the elderly in her community who have no caretakers. Patronella is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as second-hand shirts, t-shirts, trousers, and skirts. She has been operating this business for 18 months while managing to provide for her family.

She will use the Kiva loan to increase her stock to improve sales. Her hope is to expand and open her own store which will bring stability to her business. This will enable her to further her education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Muchaneta

texts.en:
Muchaneta is a 29-year-old woman who lives in the town of Guruve, Zimbabwe. She volunteers at a community hostel for girls who walk long distances to school. She is a leader in her Cama chapter who inspires young women and girls to embrace the concept of possibility-oriented living in their lives. Muchaneta also rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. As she is the family breadwinner, she started her business in order to support her three siblings. She is very proud of what she has achieved thus far in her business and would like to build upon those achievements.

The Kiva loan will assist her in stocking up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue supporting her three siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a 31-year-old woman currently living in Guruve, Zimbabwe. Josphine actively assists the elderly and less privileged as well as volunteers in schools, teaching life skills education. To support herself she sells clothing such as jackets, shirts, shorts, skirts, jerseys and trousers in the local market. Her business has been able to successfully provide for her family’s needs so far. The Kiva loan will enable her to increase her stock and thus expand her business. An increase in profits would see her business grow further, making her desire to improve her standard of living a reality.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her clothing stall

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice is a young woman from the Guruve district. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school through life skills development. She believes that children have a chance in life when they are able to make informed choices. Rejoice is currently operating a poultry business which she established when she discovered it to be a lucrative endeavor in her village.

The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her to increase profits to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed for her poultry operation

loans.name: Petronella

texts.en:
Petronella is a 22-year-old young woman living in Guruve, a district in Zimbabwe. She is very passionate about helping the elderly in her community who have no one to care for them. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide where she teaches life skills education. Petronella is currently renting a stall at a local flea market where she sells products such as secondhand shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, and baby clothes. Her business has managed to sustain her through financial hardships and she would love to improve it.

With a Kiva loan, Petronella will increase her stock to boost sales. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. Petronella will then use the proceeds from her business to advance her education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her stock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 21-year-old single young woman from the Guruve district of Zimbabwe. To give back to the community, Rose helps keep children in school through teaching life skills. She believes students can make better life choices if they are informed about the options that are available to them in life. To support herself, Rose is currently operating a poultry business which she started in 2013 and has been running for eight months. She started the business when she finished school and then realized that she needed a stable source of income. 
The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chicken feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her to increase profits in order to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and lives in the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools helping students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning. To earn an income, Maria sells shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets at the local market. She really loves her business and would like to increase her sales volume at present and expand the business. She believes that if she got the loan it would improve her business considerably.

Maria is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets to increase her stock. She intends to use the proceeds to improve her living standard and through the expansion of the business create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets to increase her stock

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is an 18-year-old young single mother of one living in Mt. Darwin, Zimbabwe. She rents a small shop where she sells groceries such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets and stationery. She also sells clothing accessories. Angela actively inspires young women in her community to be economically empowered as an entrepreneur. She started the business in 2012 as a mobile market and she is very pleased with how far she has come.

Angela would like to use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs as well as create employment in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Ruvimbo

texts.en:
Ruvimbo is a 21-year-old young woman living in Guruve, a district of Zimbabwe. She has a strong work ethic and a heart for bettering the community around her.
